Package multicast

Class VotingDesk

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • multicast.VotingDesk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, MulticastProtocol, RmiMulticastServerInterface
    public class VotingDesk
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements MulticastProtocol, RmiMulticastServerInterface
    The VotingDesk class represents a multicast server that provides the functionalities needed for a given eVoting election to occur. This server serves as a interface where both the users and the voting terminals (where the users vote) can connect to, in order to perform their activities. All voting desks are implemented as instances of this class.

    The VotingDesk being itself a multicast server implementation uses 2 multicast groups that can configured using a properties file. These groups are used for the exchange of status / discovery messages between itself and the voting terminals and another group for the exchange of critical / relevant information between the server and the terminals (multicast clients). In the exchange of server-client information this server uses a protocol that provides the primitives and basic structure of the messages that are transmitted. The implementation of this protocol is provided in the MulticastProtocol interface.

    The VotingDesk class is extends the UnicastRemoteObject class because it interacts with a centralized Remote Method Invocation server that provides all the methods needed for the exchange of relevant data e.g votes and user credentials. Also this server shares status messages with the RMI server in of for this to know about the status of the current machine. The methods necessary for this are implemented in the RmiMulticastServerInterface.

    In order for this VotingDesk to be instanced correctly it may need a configuration.properties file that follows the format specified by the Properties file format. In the case of this server the arguments required to be present in the properties file are showed in the following example: 

     server.department.name=DEI
 multicast.discovery.group=224.3.2.1
 multicast.discovery.port=6789
 multicast.voting.group=224.3.2.2
 multicast.voting.port=4321

    The server uses a logging system that automatically prints debug messages to the console and to a log file if those messages are emitted at level equal or greater than java.lang.System.Logger.Level.WARNING

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pedro Rodrigues, Miguel Rabuge
    See Also:
    UnicastRemoteObject, System.Logger, Naming, MulticastProtocol, MulticastPacket, RmiServerInterface, Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private class  VotingDesk.VotingDeskClientHandler
      This private inner class represents a thread instance that will be ran by this VotingDesk server instance managing enqueued clients.
      private class  VotingDesk.VotingDeskTerminalManager
      This private inner class represents a thread instance that will be ran by this VotingDesk server instance monitoring the status of all the server connections to the each one the VotingTerminal instances managed by it.
      private class  VotingDesk.VotingDeskVotingManager
      This private inner class represents a thread instance that will be ran by this VotingDesk server instance answering to voting and login requests made by the clients using the VotingTerminal instances connected to this server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VotingDesk

        public VotingDesk​(java.lang.String configFilePath)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Initializes a newly created VotingDesk object so that it represents multicast server instance. The configurations of this server and initialization of the data structures required in order to save relevant information.
        Parameters:
        configFilePath - A String containing the server.properties file with the configuration for this server instance.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - A RemoteException exception that occurred during the execution of a remote method call to the RMI server

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        First method that is ran on server startup parsing the command line arguments and setting up te server and handling a potential error that can occur if LocateRegistry could not find entry to the RMI server remote object exiting with exit code -1.
        Parameters:
        args - The command line arguments supplied to this function. In the case of this program the only one required is the path for the configuration file

      • print

        public void print​(java.lang.String msg)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Implementation of a RmiMulticastServerInterface method required by the RMI server in order to query information about this VotingDesk instance.

        A remote method invocation used by the RMI server to do a personalized print where this VotingDesk ID is displayed as a message preamble.

        Specified by:
        print in interface RmiMulticastServerInterface
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be displayed
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - A RemoteException exception that occurred during the execution of a remote method call to the RMI server

      • ping

        public java.lang.String ping()
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Implementation of a RmiMulticastServerInterface method required by the RMI server in order to query information about this VotingDesk instance.

        A remote method invocation used by the RMI server print information about the current status of this VotingDesk. The print message includes information about the terminals that this server has connected to it in any given moment and which users are connected to it.

        Specified by:
        ping in interface RmiMulticastServerInterface
        Returns:
        A String containing a status message about this server instance.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - A RemoteException exception that occurred during the execution of a remote method call to the RMI server

        Used by this method implementation

        See Also:
        StringBuilder

      • rmiServerRemoteExceptionHandler

        private <V> V rmiServerRemoteExceptionHandler​(java.util.concurrent.Callable<V> function)
        A wrapper method used to encapsulate RemoteException thrown by a method that requires some information to be queried from the RMI server.

        This method provides a implementation that attempts to call method passed by parameter using the Callable interface and in the event that this method fails throwing a RemoteException looping afterwards until the connection is able to be re-established with the RMI main or backup servers.

        Type Parameters:
        V - A template argument specifying the return type of the method called.
        Parameters:
        function - A Callable interface object wrapping a remote method call to the RMI server
        Returns:
        The result of the computation made by the function {@param function} parameter

      • readPropertiesFile

        private java.util.Properties readPropertiesFile​(java.lang.String path)
        This method is responsible for reading the properties file and returning a Properties object with the key-value pairs containing the server configs.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the server.properties file
        Returns:
        A properties object loaded with the server configs.

      • connectRMIServer

        private RmiServerInterface connectRMIServer()
        A method that implements the functionality that allows the VotingDesk multicast servers to connect to a RMI server running in a given address and port. In case the server does not respond the function will loop a few times in a attempt to re-connect again. This loop will last 30 seconds (by default) after which the VotingDesk will timeout, causing the server to stop its execution.
        Returns:
        The handle to the RmiServerInterface object holding the remote methods that can be invoked by this VotingDesk instance.

      • start

        public void start()
        The method that is called to prepare the server startup, reading the server configuration properties file, setting up the Logger instance configurations and connecting to the RMI server. In case an exception is thrown inside the server will catch that exception emitting an error message and automatically stopping its execution.

      • enqueueVoter

        public void enqueueVoter​(java.lang.String voter)
        This method is called by the VotingDeskUI server console and it allows a voter with a certain Citizen card ID to be placed in this server voters queue where he/she will wait until a VotingTerminal becomes available for he/she to vote (if all the conditions required for this person to vote are met).
        Parameters:
        voter - The voter with Citizen Card ID that will be placed in this server queue.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        A getter method for the name of this VotingDesk multicast server. Through this name the RMI server is able to identify this VotingDesk being able to monitor, restrict the elections that may be ran on it and query information about it. To accomplish the operations referred before this method also does an Override of the method RmiMulticastServerInterface.getName() declared in the RmiMulticastServerInterface, that is forcing its implementation in this class.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface RmiMulticastServerInterface
        Returns:
        The name identifying the current VotingDesk server instances

      • setupLogger

        private void setupLogger()
        This method is responsible for the setup of the Logger instance of this server configuring the appearance / format of the log messages displayed by this server debug console and written to the log file generated during the VotingDesk runtime.

      • votingDeskServerStartup

        private void votingDeskServerStartup()
        This method is called by the start() method allowing the creation of all the components required by the server to execute properly. It opens sockets, creates the server threads, UI instance and does the proper cleanup of such resources once the exit command is issued to this server or the UI is closed correctly (without using a signal to kill the VotingDesk server process)
